intro: Lycopersicon esculentum var. luteum, commonly known as the yellow tomato, is a variant of the domesticated tomato characterized by its yellow to orange fruit. This cultivar belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is native to South America, like its red-fleshed relatives. The yellow tomato is typically smaller than standard tomatoes and has a sweeter, more aromatic flavor. It is often used in culinary applications where a vibrant color and unique taste are desired. The plant exhibits typical tomato growth habits, with hairy stems and lobed leaves.
